intro: Globba villosula, commonly known as the hairy globba, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features rhizomatous growth and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy texture. Globba villosula is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
